meanings.definition: The act of making malicious or scandalous accusations against someone.
meanings.sent1: The mudslinging during the election was hurtful.
meanings.sent2: The political debate turned into mudslinging between the candidates.
meanings.sent3: I heard the mudslinging at school was getting out of hand.
meanings.sent4: The mudslinging in the courtroom was like a messy paint fight.
meanings.sent5: The tabloids thrive on sensational mudslinging stories.

meanings.definition: Engaging in personal attacks or insults in order to damage someone's reputation.
meanings.sent1: She was mudslinging at her opponent during the debate.
meanings.sent2: The rival companies were mudslinging to gain an advantage.
meanings.sent3: The siblings playfully mudslinged insults at each other.
meanings.sent4: His words were like mudslinging arrows hitting their mark.
meanings.sent5: The online trolls were mudslinging without any regard for the truth.
